section.title: Converting JSON to XML in Oxygen
section.p:
includes a useful and simple tool for converting JSON files to XML. The JSON to XML action for invoking the tool can be found in the
Tools JSON Tools
XML Tools JSON Tools menu.
To convert a JSON document to XML, follow these steps:

li.p:
Select the JSON to XML action from the Tools JSON Tools
XML Tools JSON Tools menu.
The JSON to XML dialog box is displayed:

ol.li: Choose or enter the Input URL of the JSON document.
Choose the path of the Output file that will contain the resulting XML document.
Select the Open in Editor option to open the resulting XML document in the main editing pane.

section.p: Result: The original JSON document is now converted to an XML document.

fig.title: Example: XML to JSON Operation Result

li.p: If the JSON document has more than one property on the first level, the converted XML document will have an additional root element called JSON.
it is converted to:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <JSON> <personnel> <person> <name>Boss</name> </person> <person> <name>Worker</name> </person> </personnel> <id>personnel-id</id> </JSON>

If the JSON document is an array, the converted XML document will have a root element called array and for each item within the array, another array is created.[ {"name": "Boss"}, {"name": "Worker"} ]
it is converted to:<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <array> <array> <name>Boss</name> </array> <array> <name>Worker</name> </array> </array>

If the name of a JSON property contains characters that are not valid in XML element names (for example, $), then the invalid characters will be escaped as its hexadecimal equivalent in the converted XML.{"$id": "personnel-id"}
